Our choices for this, as I understand them, are now:

1. Make two separate postcommits that run in parallel, hacking the pom in a way such that we can invoke them separately easily.
2. Run the executions simultaneously in a single postcommit (not sure if Maven can do this, or how to config it)
3. Bump the timeout to 3 or 4 hours. Probably a major pain for productivity.
4. Drop this PR and wait until pipelined jobs to revisit this. An unfortunate lack of coverage in the meantime.
(no plans to move on this until there is consensus)
Run Seed Job
Hmm, rebase fail. I'll see if our new pom configuration is compatible with going all the way on this.

Looking around at SO, it seems as though people use `Integer.MAX_VALUE - 5` or `Integer.MAX_VALUE - 8`, Why did you do `Integer.MAX_VALUE - 2`?

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/3038392/do-java-arrays-have-a-maximum-size

I would go with the `Integer.MAX_VALUE - 8` based upon the above SO question.

@aaltay, this place looks good to me. @jkff, @ssisk , @iemejia what is your opinion on adding the Hive use-case at - https://beam.apache.org/documentation/io/built-in/hadoop/ and propose to close the ticket BEAM-1158

Yes, I seem to keep failing to exclude enough test classes. It seems likely that the failure is not directly related to just the things in those tests, but something used in basically all tests is nondeterministic.
I think the first commit here looks obviously correct. Since it passed unit tests and will get us closer to success, I can merge just that bit quite easily.
Well, let's actually just continue to work through the failures here. Best to be on your PR than mine.
I'll close this one.
